STATE PUBLIC HEALTH APPROACHES TO ADDRESS ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE AND RELATED DEMENTIAS-CORE CAPACITY - ARKANSAS BOLD PUBLIC HEALTH PROGRAMS TO ADDRESS ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE AND RELATED DEMENTIAS (ADRD) CDC-RFA-DP20-2004 (CORE CAPACITY) APPLICATIONPROJECT SUMMARY ABSTRACTALZHEIMER?S DISEASE, AN AGE-RELATED NEURODEGENERATIVE DISEASE WAS THE 4TH LEADING CAUSE OF DEATH AMONG ARKANSANS AGED 65 YEARS AND OLDER COMPARED TO THE NATIONAL RANK AS THE 5TH LEADING CAUSE OF DEATH IN 2018.1 ADDITIONALLY, ARKANSAS?S MORTALITY RATE FOR ALZHEIMER?S DISEASE AT 281.9/100,000 POPULATION WAS HIGHER THAN THE CORRESPONDING US MORTALITY RATE OF 230.1/100,000 POPULATION WITH A MORTALITY RATIO OF 48.3.1,2 WHILE ARKANSAS RANKED 23RD AMONG STATES FOR ALZHEIMER?S DISEASE MORTALITY IN 2013, THIS RANK AND RATE MOVED UP TO 13TH PLACE AMONG STATES IN 2018, INDICATING MORE ARKANSANS AGED 65 YEARS AND OLDER ARE SUCCUMBING TO ALZHEIMER?S DISEASE OVER TIME.1 ONE OUT OF THREE SENIORS WHO DIES IS DIAGNOSED WITH ALZHEIMER?S OR ANOTHER DEMENTIA ANNUALLY.2PURPOSE: THE ARKANSAS DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH?S (ADH) ALZHEIMER?S DISEASE AND RELATED DEMENTIAS (ADRD) PROGRAM, ARKANSAS ALZHEIMER?S DISEASE AND RELATED DEMENTIAS PROGRAM (AADRD) PROGRAM PROPOSES TO DEVELOP INFRASTRUCTURE AND AN ADRD STRATEGIC PLAN THROUGH THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION (CDC) ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE AND HEALTHY AGING PROGRAM?S CORE CAPACITY FUNDING AWARD OPPORTUNITY. THE ADH WITH RELEVANT PARTNERS WILL PLAN A STATEWIDE PUBLIC HEALTH (PH) APPROACH TO ADRD THROUGH RISK REDUCTION FOR PRIMARY PREVENTION, EARLY DIAGNOSIS FOR SECONDARY PREVENTION, AND MANAGEMENT OF COMORBIDITIES AND PREVENTABLE HOSPITALIZATIONS FOR TERTIARY PREVENTION, CAREGIVING FOR PERSONS WITH ADRD, AND DATA COLLECTION.OUTCOMES: CORE CAPACITY SHORT-TERM AND INTERMEDIATE OUTCOMES INCLUDE:1. INCREASE THE NUMBER OF ADRD STAKEHOLDERS ENGAGING IN STATEWIDE DEMENTIA COLLABORATION AND ACTIONS.2. INCREASE THE INCLUSION OF THE AREAS OF DEMENTIA RISK REDUCTION (PRIMARY PREVENTION), EARLY DIAGNOSIS OF ADRD (SECONDARY PREVENTION), PREVENTION AND MANAG EMENT OF COMORBIDITIES AND AVOIDABLE HOSPITALIZATIONS (TERTIARY PREVENTION) IN PROGRAM PLANNING AND PRIORITY SETTING.3. INCREASE THE INCLUSION OF ROAD MAP (RM) SERIES ACTIONS:? E-2 INTEGRATION OF BRAIN HEALTH RISK REDUCTION INTO EXISTING HEALTH COMMUNICATIONS.? P-1 PROMOTE THE USE OF EFFECTIVE INTERVENTIONS AND BEST PRACTICES TO PROTECT BRAIN HEALTH, ADDRESS COGNITIVE IMPAIRMENT, AND HELP MEET THE NEEDS OF CAREGIVERS FOR PEOPLE WITH DEMENTIA.? W-3 IMPROVED KNOWLEDGE BY HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONALS ABOUT THE BEST AVAILABLE EVIDENCE ON DEMENTIA, CAREGIVING FOR PERSONS WITH DEMENTIA, AND TOOLS AND SUPPORTS AVAILABLE.? M-1 IMPLEMENT THE BEHAVIORAL RISK FACTOR SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM (BRFSS) OPTIONAL MODULE FOR COGNITIVE DECLINE IN 2021, AND THE BRFSS OPTIONAL MODULE FOR CAREGIVING IN 2021.? M-3 USE DATA GLEANED THROUGH AVAILABLE SURVEILLANCE STRATEGIES AND OTHER SOURCES TO INFORM THE PH PROGRAM AND POLICY RESPONSE TO COGNITIVE HEALTH, IMPAIRMENT, AND CAREGIVING.1. CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION, NATIONAL CENTER FOR HEALTH STATISTICS. UNDERLYING CAUSE OF DEATH 1999-2018 ON CDC WONDER ONLINE DATABASE.2. ALZHEIMER?S ASSOCIATION, 2020 ALZHEIMER?S DISEASE FACTS AND FIGURES.

BOSTON PUBLIC HEALTH COMMISSION BOLD PROJECT - THE BOSTON PUBLIC HEALTH COMMISSION (BPHC, THE CITY?S HEALTH DEPARTMENT) IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE BOSTON AGE STRONG COMMISSION (THE CITY?S COUNCIL ON AGING AND AREA AGENCY ON AGING) AND AN OUTSTANDING GROUP OF PROJECT PARTNERS PROPOSE A BOLD PROJECT TO ADDRESS ALZHEIMER?S DISEASE AND RELATED DEMENTIAS IN BOSTON. WE ARE APPLYING FOR THE CORE CAPACITY AWARD.THE PURPOSE OF THE BOSTON BOLD PROJECT IS TO BRING TOGETHER A MULTI-DISCIPLINARY TEAM OF STAKEHOLDERS?INCLUDING PUBLIC HEALTH, THE LOCAL OFFICE ON AGING, THE STATE ALZHEIMER?S ORGANIZATION, CLINICAL EXPERTS, CAREGIVERS, THE LOCAL HOUSING AUTHORITY AND OTHER COMMUNITY PARTNERS?TO MORE EFFECTIVELY ADDRESS PRIMARY, SECONDARY AND TERTIARY PREVENTION OF DEMENTIA IN BOSTON. THROUGH THIS PROJECT, WE WILL: MOBILIZE KEY PARTNERS, ESTABLISH A CITYWIDE ADVISORY COMMITTEE, CONDUCT A NEEDS ASSESSMENT, CREATE AN ADRD STRATEGIC PLAN, AND CONDUCT SYSTEMS, ENVIRONMENTAL, POLICY AND EDUCATION ACTIVITIES TO PROMOTE DEMENTIA RISK REDUCTION, EARLY DIAGNOSIS, CAREGIVING, AND THE PREVENTION AND MANAGEMENT OF COMORBIDITIES AND AVOIDABLE HOSPITALIZATIONS. IN ADDITION, THE PROJECT WILL SPECIFICALLY IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS POTENTIAL CHALLENGES TO PROJECT ACTIVITIES AND GOALS ARISING FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.KEY PROJECT OBJECTIVES ARE:OBJECTIVE 1. CITYWIDE ADVISORY COMMITTEE: BY MONTH 1, MOBILIZE A MINIMUM OF SEVEN KEY PARTNERS TO ESTABLISH A MULTIDISCIPLINARY CITYWIDE ADVISORY COMMITTEE THAT WILL OVERSEE THE PROJECT?S NEEDS ASSESSMENT, STRATEGIC PLANNING PROCESS AND IMPLEMENTATION ACTIVITIES.OBJECTIVE 2. NEEDS ASSESSMENT AND STRATEGIC PLAN: BY MONTH 9-12, ENGAGING THE ADVISORY COMMITTEE AND A WIDE RANGE OF STAKEHOLDERS, COMPLETE A LOCAL NEEDS ASSESSMENT AND DEVELOP A STRATEGIC PLAN ENCOMPASSING DEMENTIA RISK REDUCTION, EARLY DIAGNOSIS OF ADTD AND THE PREVENTION AND TREATMENT OF COMORBIDITIES AND AVOIDABLE HOSPITALIZATIONS. (THIS OBJECTIVE IS INTENDED TO SUPPORT ACTION P-1?PROMOTING THE USE OF EFFECTIVE INTERVENTIONS AND BE ST PRACTICES?AND ACTION M-3?USING DATA TO INFORM THE PUBLIC HEALTH PROGRAM AND POLICY RESPONSE TO BRAIN HEALTH, COGNITIVE IMPAIRMENT AND CAREGIVING.)OBJECTIVE 3. IMPLEMENTATION ACTIONS: IMPLEMENT A MINIMUM OF THREE ACTIONS OVER THE PROJECT PERIOD: (1) PROMOTE INTEGRATION OF BRAIN HEALTH RISK REDUCTION INTO EXISTING HEALTH COMMUNICATION, (2) IMPROVE KNOWLEDGE BY HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONALS ABOUT THE BEST AVAILABLE EVIDENCE ON DEMENTIA, CAREGIVING FOR PERSONS WITH DEMENTIA, AND TOOLS AND SUPPORTS AVAILABLE EDUCATION, AND (3) PROVIDE CONTINUING EDUCATION TO IMPROVE HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONAL?S KNOWLEDGE.

BOLD PUBLIC HEALTH PROGRAMS TO ADDRESS ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE AND RELATED DEMENTIAS - ALZHEIMER’S DISEASE AND RELATED DEMENTIAS (ADRD) IS AN EMERGING PUBLIC HEALTH CRISIS FOR TENNESSEE AND THE NATION.  MANY STATES, INCLUDING TENNESSEE, RECOGNIZE THE GROWING BURDEN OF ADRD AND THE NEED TO PROMOTE CURRENT PUBLIC HEALTH EFFORTS TO PROMOTE COGNITIVE HEALTH AND ADDRESS COGNITIVE IMPAIRMENT. BY 2030, THE NUMBER OF TENNESSEANS 60 YEARS AND OLDER WILL GROW BY 37 PERCENT TO 2.16 MILLION INDIVIDUALS, 28 PERCENT OF THE STATE’S POPULATION.1 WHILE AGING IS AN INEVITABLE PROCESS, RESEARCH SHOWS EVIDENCE THAT IMPLEMENTING HEALTHY BEHAVIORS THROUGHOUT AN INDIVIDUAL’S LIFETIME MAY REDUCE THE RISK OF COGNITIVE DECLINE AND DEMENTIA.2 THIS EVIDENCE REQUIRES PUBLIC HEALTH TO TAKE A LIFE-COURSE APPROACH THAT FOCUSES ON REDUCING MODIFIABLE RISK FACTORS EARLIER TO IMPROVE HEALTH OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH ADRD. THE HEALTHY BRAIN INITIATIVE, DEVELOPED BY THE ALZHEIMER’S ASSOCIATION AND CDC, ENCOURAGES STATES TO FOCUS INTERVENTIONS AND RESOURCES TOWARD REDUCING HEALTH DISPARITIES AMONG POPULATIONS THAT ARE MOST LIKELY TO BE IMPACTED BY ADRD, SUCH AS AFRICAN AMERICANS, HISPANICS, AND WOMEN. IN 2017, RACIAL DISPARITIES IN PREVALENCE OF ADRD IN TENNESSEE AMONG THOSE AGED 65 AND OLDER WERE 12.2 PERCENT FOR NON-HISPANIC WHITES, 14.6 PERCENT FOR AFRICAN AMERICANS, AND 9.2 PERCENT FOR HISPANICS (REFERENCE). IN 2018, ALZHEIMER’S DISEASE WAS THE 6TH LEADING CAUSE OF DEATH AMONG OUR STATE’S AFRICAN AMERICAN WOMEN AND WAS THE 8TH LEADING CAUSE OF DEATH FOR ALL AFRICAN AMERICANS (REFERENCE). TDH WILL UTILIZE ACTIONS WITHIN EACH OF THE FOUR ESSENTIAL SERVICES OF PUBLIC HEALTH OUTLINED IN THE HEALTHY BRAIN INITIATIVE’S 2018-2023 ROAD MAP (RM) TO REDUCE THESE HEALTH DISPARITIES, COLLABORATE ACROSS MULTIPLE SECTORS, AND LEVERAGE RESOURCES FOR SUSTAINED IMPACT. THE 2020 TENNESSEE ALZHEIMER’S AND RELATED DEMENTIA STATE PLAN INCORPORATES MANY OF THE RM SERIES ACTIONS. THE PLAN ESTABLISHES THE ACCOUNTABILITY NECESSARY TO BUILD DEMENTIA-CAPABLE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO ADDRESS ADRD IN TENNESSEE. AS OUTLINED IN THE APPLICATION NARRATIVE, TDH WILL FURTHER UTILIZE DATA, INCLUDING BRFSS, TO INFORM THE UPDATE TO THE 2021 ALZHEIMER’S AND RELATED DEMENTIA STATE PLAN. TDH IDENTIFIED PRIORITY NEEDS FROM THE 2019 EDITION OF THE STATE HEALTH PLAN AND THE 2020 TENNESSEE ALZHEIMER’S AND RELATED DEMENTIA STATE PLAN FOR THIS PROPOSAL WHICH INCLUDE: 1) EDUCATE THE PUBLIC AND HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS ABOUT BRAIN HEALTH, COGNITIVE AGING AND RISK REDUCTION AWARENESS; 2) BENEFITS OF EARLY AND ACCURATE DIAGNOSIS WITH MANAGEMENT OF COMORBIDITIES; 3) ENGAGEMENT AND SUPPORT FROM FAITH COMMUNITIES TO INCREASE ATTENTION TO CAREGIVERS HEALTH AND ASSISTANCE NAVIGATING RESOURCES;4) COMPETENT DEMENTIA CARE COMMUNITIES; AND 5) INCREASE SOURCES OF DATA AND SURVEILLANCE. TDH WILL FOCUS ON FIVE CROSS CUTTING, PROJECTS TO CARRY OUT THE RM SUGGESTED ACTIONS AND TO ADDRESS THE PRIORITIES OUTLINED IN THE 2019 EDITION OF THE TENNESSEE STATE HEALTH PLAN AND 2020 TENNESSEE ALZHEIMER’S AND RELATED DEMENTIA STATE PLAN. THE PROJECTS WILL ACCOMPLISH THE FOLLOWING GOALS: 1.	EXPAND THE USE OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND FAITH PARTNERSHIPS THAT FOCUS ON ADDRESSING COGNITIVE IMPAIRMENT AND HEALTH DISPARITIES. 2.	INCREASE SURVEILLANCE AND USE OF DATA DRIVEN DECISION MAKING FOR PROGRAM DELIVERY. 3.	ACHIEVE AN ADRD COMPETENT WORKFORCE IN TENNESSEE THROUGH TRAINING AND EDUCATION. 4.	PROMOTE PUBLIC AWARENESS OF COGNITIVE AND BRAIN HEALTH, AND RISK REDUCTION. 5.	ENSURE ADVANCED DIRECTIVE AND ADVANCED CARE PLANNING MATERIALS AND SUPPORTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THOSE LIVING WITH ADRD, CAREGIVERS, AND HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS AND WORKERS. THE FIRST SIX MONTHS OF THE NOFO PROJECT PERIOD WILL BE USED TO ESTABLISH THE CONGREGATIONAL ADRD ADVISORY COMMITTEE, TO FURTHER DEFINE COMMUNITY AND PROVIDER NEEDS, AND TO DEVELOP MATERIALS FOR EACH OF THE FIVE PROJECTS. SUCCESS WILL BE MEASURED UTILIZING BOTH PROCESS AND OUTCOME MEASURES BY A THIRD

BOLD CORE ADRD PUBLIC HEALTH PREVENTION PROGRAMS IN SOUTH CAROLINA - SOUTH CAROLINA (SC) HAS AN ALZHEIMER?S DISEASE CRISIS AND THE POPULATION IS GETTING OLDER EACH YEAR. WE SEE MORE AND MORE SOUTH CAROLINIANS DYING FROM ALZHEIMER?S DISEASE, WITH A 199% INCREASE SINCE 2000.  IN FACT, IN 2015, SC HAD THE HIGHEST ALZHEIMER?S DEATH RATE IN AMERICA. THE SOUTH CAROLINA STATE HEALTH PLAN INDICATES THAT 64.6% OF SC RESIDENTS ARE NON-HISPANIC WHITE, 27.5% ARE NON-HISPANIC BLACK AND 5.7% ARE HISPANIC/LATINO MAKING UP 3.1 MILLION RESIDENTS, 1.3 MILLION RESIDENTS AND 272,792 RESIDENTS, RESPECTIVELY. AN ALZHEIMER?S ASSOCIATION IMPACT MOVEMENT FACT SHEET ON RACE, ETHNICITY, AND ALZHEIMER?S INDICATES THAT WHITES MAKE UP THE MAJORITY OF ALZHEIMER?S CASES ACROSS THE US, BUT AFRICAN AMERICANS AND HISPANICS ARE AT A HIGHER RISK AND ARE LESS LIKELY TO BE DIAGNOSED AT AN EARLY STAGE. A LARGE PROPORTION OF SOUTH CAROLINIANS ARE AT GREAT RISK FOR CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASE AND DISPARITIES EXIST IN RACE/ETHNICITY AS WELL AS RURALITY. PRIMARY CARE PROVIDERS, ESPECIALLY IN RURAL AREAS, LACK SPECIALIZED CARE AND ARE RELIED UPON FOR THE MANAGEMENT OF ANY AND ALL CHRONIC DISEASES. MANY HAVE INDICATED THEY FEEL ILL PREPARED TO HANDLE THE SURGE OF THE ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE AND RELATED DEMENTIAS (ADRD) DEMAND AND THEY LACK THE SKILLS NEEDED FOR EARLY DIAGNOSIS AND ADEQUATE DISEASE MANAGEMENT AS WELL AS RESOURCES AVAILABLE FOR CAREGIVERS. PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS ARE OFTEN SERVING THE UNDERSERVED AND MOST VULNERABLE AS WELL AND NEED ADEQUATE RESOURCES AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES TO PROVIDE CARE TO THE POPULATIONS THEY SERVE.IN RESPONSE, PARTNERS WILL BE MOBILIZED TO FORM AN ADRD STATEWIDE COALITION TO CREATE AN ADRD STRATEGIC PLAN TO IMPLEMENT THE CDC?S HEALTHY BRAIN INITIATIVE ROAD MAP. ROAD MAP (RM) MEASURES E-1, E-2, W-3, P-1, M-1 AND M-3 WILL BE IMPLEMENTED. THE ?TAKE BRAIN HEALTH TO HEART? COMMUNICATIONS AND EDUCATIONAL CAMPAIGN WILL BE UPDATED AND PROMOTED TO ADDRESS RM MEASURE E-1, CHRONIC DISEASE DIRECTORS WILL ALSO ASSIST IN INTEGRATIO N OF EXISTING PROGRAM EFFORTS AND MESSAGING, RM MEASURE E-2. THE CAMPAIGN WEBSITE WILL BE UPDATED TO INCLUDE AN ARRAY OF RESOURCES, INCLUDING ITEMS FOR PCPS AND PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS, ADDRESSING RM MEASURE W-3.  A STATEWIDE STRATEGIC PLAN IMPLEMENTING RM MEASURES WILL BE CREATED TO ADDRESS P-1. ALL EFFORTS WILL BE DRIVEN BY DATA, RM MEASURE M-3, INCLUDING RM MEASURE M-1, ADDING OPTIONAL MODULES ON COGNITIVE DECLINE AND CAREGIVING TO THE BRFSS IN THE 2021 INTEGRATION. ALL EFFORTS WILL USE POLICY, SYSTEMS AND ENVIRONMENTAL INTERVENTIONS AND A PUBLIC HEALTH APPROACH TO ADDRESS SHORT-TERM AND INTERMEDIATE OUTCOMES BY THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD TO INCLUDE: INCREASING THE NUMBER OF ADRD STAKEHOLDERS ENGAGING IN JURISDICTION-WIDE COLLABORATION AND ACTIONS; INCREASING THE INCLUSION OF THE AREAS OF DEMENTIA RISK REDUCTION (PRIMARY PREVENTION), EARLY DIAGNOSIS OF ADRD (SECONDARY PREVENTION), PREVENTION AND MANAGEMENT OF COMORBIDITIES AND AVOIDABLE HOSPITALIZATIONS (TERTIARY PREVENTION) IN PROGRAM PLANNING AND PRIORITY SETTING, AND; INCREASING THE INCLUSION OF RM SERIES ACTIONS TO AT LEAST FOUR (4) ACTIONS THAT ARE REFLECTED IN ADRD STATE STRATEGIC PLAN.THE SOUTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL (DHEC), IN WORK WITH PARTNERS, IS POSITIONED TO LEAD THE BOLD CORE ADRD PUBLIC HEALTH PREVENTION PROGRAMS IN SOUTH CAROLINA EFFORT. RELIABLE FUNDING FOR THE UPCOMING THREE YEARS WILL SUPPORT COORDINATED, INTERDISCIPLINARY WORK TO FIGHT THE ADRD EPIDEMIC STATEWIDE.

CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH APPLICATION FOR CORE CAPACITY  AWARD - THE PURPOSE OF THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH?S PROPOSAL IS TO DEVELOP ITS EFFORTS IN IMPLEMENTING A PUBLIC HEALTH APPROACH THROUGH COLLABORATIVE INITIATIVES TO INFORM POLICY, SYSTEMS AND ENVIRONMENTAL CHANGES THAT DECREASE ALZHEIMER?S DISEASE AND RELATED DEMENTIAS BURDEN IN CT.  THROUGH THE PLANNING ACTIVITIES OF A CORE CAPACITY AWARD, THIS WILL BE ACHIEVED BY:?SUPPORTING INCREASED, COORDINATED AND COLLABORATIVE COMMUNICATION ACROSS THE STATE RELATED TO ADRD;?DEVELOPING A STRATEGIC PLAN FOR ADRD USING ROAD MAP SERIES ACTIONS AND PUBLIC HEALTH APPROACH;?INCREASING AWARENESS AMONG PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONAL AND POLICY MAKERS ABOUT BRFSS DATA ON ADRD; ?INCREASING AWARENESS AMONG PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONAL AND POLICY MAKERS ABOUT HOSPITALIZATION AND ED DATA ON ADRD;?DEVELOPING FRAMEWORK FOR PUBLIC HEALTH CAMPAIGN FOCUSED ON ADRD EARLY DETECTION AND DIAGNOSIS FOR IDENTIFIED PRIORITY POPULATION FOR IMPLEMENTATION IN AUGUST 2023;?EXPLORING OPPORTUNITY TO ENGAGE COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKERS TO SUPPORT EARLY DETECTION AND DIAGNOSIS EFFORTS IN UNDERSERVED AREAS; AND,?DEVELOPING FRAMEWORK FOR EDUCATION OF HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONALS FOCUSED ON EARLY DIAGNOSIS AND DISCLOSURE OF ADRD, EFFECTIVE CARE PLANNING AND ENGAGING CAREGIVERS FOR IMPLEMENTATION IN AUGUST 2023.THE FOLLOWING ARE THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES THAT THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH HOPES TO ACCOMPLISH BY THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD:?EFFECTIVE INTERVENTIONS AND BEST PRACTICES USED IN PUBLIC HEALTH PROGRAMS  ?PUBLIC HEALTH PRIORITIES AND ACTIONS INFORMED BY DATA?ADRD PUBLIC EDUCATION CAMPAIGN FRAMEWORK DEVELOPED?ADRD PROFESSIONAL EDUCATION CAMPAIGN FRAMEWORK DEVELOPEDTHROUGH THE STRATEGIES AND ACTIVITIES OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT, IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT CONNECTICUT RESIDENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES LIVING WITH ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE AND RELATED DEMENTIAS  ARE IMPROVED AND EXPERIENCE BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE IN A SUPPORTED ENVIRONMENT.

WELL-AHEAD LOUISIANA BOLD (CORE CAPACITY) - OBJECTIVE: WELL-AHEAD LOUISIANA?S PROJECT PROPOSAL ADDRESSES THE NEED FOR PUBLIC HEALTH INFRASTRUCTURE IN LOUISIANA TO BUILD CAPACITY FOR EFFECTIVE PREVENTION AND TREATMENT OF ALZHEIMER?S DISEASE AND RELATED DEMENTIAS (ADRD) FOR LOUISIANA CITIZENS.  PROJECT PROPOSAL: WELL-AHEAD LOUISIANA PROPOSES IMPLEMENTATION OF THE WELL-AHEAD HEALTHY AGING PROGRAM (WAL-HAP) TO LEVERAGE RESOURCES, EXPAND COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, AND IMPLEMENT EVIDENCE-BASED STRATEGIES TO INCREASE AWARENESS OF BEST PRACTICES FOR BRAIN HEALTH, INCREASE KNOWLEDGE OF COGNITIVE DECLINE RISK FACTORS, INCREASE CAREGIVER SUPPORT AND RESOURCES, AND INCREASE THE NUMBER OF HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS WHO ARE EFFECTIVELY TRAINED TO ADDRESS THE CHALLENGES OF PATIENTS WITH ADRD. WAL-HAP WILL CREATE A HEALTHY AGING TASK FORCE WHICH WILL CONVENE MULTI-SECTORAL PARTNERS TO DEVELOP A 5-YEAR LOUISIANA HEALTHY AGING STATE PLAN (LHASP). THE WAL-HAP WILL BUILD UPON THE SUCCESS OF WELL-AHEAD LOUISIANA?S WELLSPOT DESIGNATION PROGRAM (WSD) AND THE WELL-AHEAD PROVIDER EDUCATION NETWORK (WALPEN). THROUGH WSD, THE WAL-HAP WILL INTEGRATE RESOURCES PROMOTING BRAIN HEALTH AND AWARENESS OF COGNITIVE DECLINE RISK FACTORS INTO CURRENT WORKSITE WELLNESS IMPLEMENTATION RESOURCES. WAL-HAP WILL UTILIZE WALPEN TO PROVIDE ADRD TRAININGS AND RESOURCES TO HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS. TRAININGS AND RESOURCES WILL BE DISSEMINATED VIA WEBINARS, NEWSLETTERS, AND LISTSERVS. WAL-HAP WILL ALSO REVIEW AND REVISE RESOURCES ON THE EXISTING ?HEALTHY AGING? PAGE ON WWW.WELLAHEADLA.COM. OUTCOMES: WAL-HAP EXPECTS TO ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES:DEVELOP POLICIES & MOBILIZE PARTNERSHIPS: 1) INCREASE THE NUMBER OF ADRD STAKEHOLDERS ENGAGING IN STATEWIDE COLLABORATION AND ACTION BY ESTABLISHING AND MAINTAINING THE HATF AND BUILDING CAPACITY TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT THE LHASP AND 2) INCREASE THE THREE INCLUSION AREAS OF DEMENTIA RISK REDUCTION BY RECEIVING GOVERNOR ENDORSEMENT [OR SECRETARY OF HEALTH] OF THE LHASP. MONITOR & EVALUATE: 1) USE  DATA TO INFORM THE PUBLIC HEALTH PROGRAM AND POLICY RESPONSE TO COGNITIVE HEALTH, IMPAIRMENT, AND CAREGIVING BY DISSEMINATING SURVEILLANCE AND EVALUATION FINDINGS TO STAKEHOLDERS, CREATION OF ANNUAL FACT SHEETS, AND A PROJECT PERIOD EVALUATION REPORT. EDUCATE & EMPOWER: 1) INTEGRATE BRAIN HEALTH RISK REDUCTION RESOURCES INTO EXISTING COMMUNICATIONS AND INCREASE MESSAGING ON CAREGIVER SUPPORT BY INCREASING COORDINATED MESSAGING STRATEGIES FROM 0 TO 1 AND REACHING 75% OF WELLSPOT DESIGNATED SITES ; 2) INTEGRATE BRAIN HEALTH RISK REDUCTION AND INCREASE MESSAGING ON CAREGIVER SUPPORT INTO WELLSPOT DESIGNATION WORKSITE RECOGNITION PROGRAM AND 3) PROMOTE THE USE OF BEST PRACTICES TO PROTECT BRAIN HEALTH, ADDRESS COGNITIVE IMPAIRMENT, AND HELP MEET THE NEEDS OF CAREGIVERS FOR PEOPLE WITH DEMENTIA BY MAINTAINING AND DISSEMINATING A BI-ANNUAL NEWSLETTER AND CONDUCTING 3 WORKSHOPS AT CONFERENCES. ASSURE A COMPETENT WORKFORCE: 1) PROVIDE 15 PROFESSIONAL EDUCATION OPPORTUNITIES AND INCREASE WAL PROVIDER EDUCATION NETWORK (WALPEN) MEMBERSHIP BY 15% TO IMPROVE HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONALS? KNOWLEDGE OF ADRD, RISK REDUCTION STRATEGIES, AND THE IMPORTANCE OF TREATING COMORBIDITIES.KEY PERSONNEL: KEY PERSONNEL FROM WELL-AHEAD INCLUDE WELL-AHEAD DEPUTY DIRECTOR, HEALTHY COMMUNITIES DIVISION MANAGER, BOLD MANAGER, ADMINISTRATIVE PROGRAM DIRECTOR, EVALUATION COORDINATOR, EPIDEMIOLOGY MANAGER, WELLSPOT DESIGNATION MANAGER, PROVIDER EDUCATION NETWORK MANAGER AND A CONTENT MANAGER.

IDAHO - BOLD PUBLIC HEALTH PROGRAMS TO ADDRESS ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE AND RELATED DEMENTIAS - PROJECT ABSTRACT THE IDAHO PHYSICAL ACTIVITY AND NUTRITION (IPAN) PROGRAM IS REQUESTING FUNDING FROM THE CENTER FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION TO IMPLEMENT ?BOLD PUBLIC HEALTH PROGRAMS TO ADDRESS ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE AND RELATED DEMENTIAS IN IDAHO.? FUNDING WILL BE UTILIZED TO BUILD CAPACITY AND INFRASTRUCTURE TO ADDRESS ADRD ACROSS IDAHO. SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES TO BE IMPLEMENTED DURING THIS PROJECT PERIOD WILL INCLUDE: CONDUCT A LANDSCAPE ANALYSIS AND NEEDS ASSESSMENT, CONVENE STAKEHOLDERS TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A STATEWIDE STRATEGIC PLAN, PRIORITIZE NEEDS FOR PRIMARY, SECONDARY AND TERTIARY PREVENTION EFFORTS, AND IMPLEMENT STRATEGIES FROM THE HEALTHY BRAIN INITIATIVE ROAD MAP SERIES. THE IPAN PROGRAM UTILIZED THE CDC LOGIC MODEL TO GUIDE THE DEVELOPMENT OF WORK PLAN STRATEGIES AND ACTIVITIES FUNDED THROUGH THIS GRANT. THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES ARE EXPECTED TO BE ACHIEVED BY THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD BY IMPLEMENTING THE PROGRAM STRATEGIES IDENTIFIED BELOW AND IN THE ATTACHED WORK PLAN. ACHIEVEMENT OF THE INTENDED OUTCOMES WILL BE BASED ON EVALUATION AND PERFORMANCE. SHORT TERM OUTCOMES:?INCREASE THE NUMBER OF ADRD STAKEHOLDERS ENGAGING IN JURISDICTION-WIDE ADRD COLLABORATION AND ACTION. ?INCREASE THE INCLUSION OF THE AREAS OF DEMENTIA RISK REDUCTION (PRIMARY PREVENTION), EARLY DIAGNOSIS OF ADRD (SECONDARY PREVENTION), PREVENTION AND MANAGEMENT OF COMORBIDITIES AND AVOIDABLE HOSPITALIZATIONS (TERTIARY PREVENTION) IN PROGRAM PLANNING AND PRIORITY SETTING.?IMPLEMENT STRATEGIES FROM THE HBI RM SERIES, INCLUDING:?USE OF EFFECTIVE INTERVENTIONS BY PUBLIC HEALTH PROGRAM (P-1)?USE OF DATA, INCLUDING THE BEHAVIORAL RISK FACTOR SURVEILLANCE SYSTEMS (BRFSS), TO INFORM PUBLIC HEALTH PRIORITIES AND ACTION (M-3).?PUBLIC EDUCATION ABOUT BRAIN HEALTH AND THE IMPORTANCE OF TALKING TO A HEALTH PROFESSIONAL (E-1)?INTEGRATION OF BRAIN HEALTH RISK REDUCTION INTO EXISTING HEALTH COMMUNICATIONS (E-2)?INCREASE MESSAGING ABOUT THE IMPORTANT ROLE OF CAREGIVERS (E-3)?IMPROVED KNOWLEDGE BY HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONALS ABOUT THE BEST AVAILABLE EVIDENCE ON DEMENTIA, CAREGIVING FOR PERSONS WITH DEMENTIA, AND TOOLS AND SUPPORTS AVAILABLE (W-3)?CONTINUING EDUCATION TO IMPROVE HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONAL?S KNOWLEDGE (W-4)?HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONALS' KNOWLEDGE ABOUT THE IMPORTANCE OF TREATING CO-MORBIDITIES AND RISK REDUCTION STRATEGIES (W-6)
